content.description: very thin crack to the left of mambo jambo. Never seen a true lead. Go get it. Finishes on mambo jambo, either through left crack or slab.
content.location: to the left of mambo jambo

content.description: scramble up the gulley in between towers to a belay bolt on the right. Climb left on steep rock following 5 bolts to the top.
content.location: in between the towers, on tower 2

content.description: starts on whynoceros and traverse right after 2nd bolt into an awkward left leaning crack.
content.location: same start as whynoceros, at the belay bolt

content.description: A fun crack in Repo II.  Interesting start.  Don't cheat and use the nearby boulder! Nice hands and a really fun slab section at the top (from a different route? there are two bolts here).
content.protection:
Anchors on top reached by zigzag access to right.

Pro to 1.5"
content.location: In Repo II area, on the right side of the pillar near the arete.  There is a 5.8 crack next to this route that is less fun.

content.description:
The route is on Repo II Wall, only a short distance to the right from the route "Human Foot" on Blackstone Wall.  Follow the perfect hand crack up the steep wall, then follow the crack as it trends on a leftward ramp system.  The ramp seems to be the crux, with some awkward jamming moves.

This is a great trad route in an area dominated by nice sport routes.  So bring the rack along, and when the fingers get tired after a day of crimping, start jamming!
content.protection: Set of cams up to #3 Camelot.  The #3 works well on the left-leaning section.  Bolted rap station at the top.
content.location:
Follow the trail to Blackstone wall, then head right along the base for a hundred feet or so.  The route is the obvious handcrack (just about the only handcrack in the area).

Rappel the route with one rope (50m rope works).

content.description: Start up the arete or just slightly right of the arete on the face. There are two bolts just right of the arete. Ends on face with 2 bolts and the bolted anchor of Repo Man.

Blocky 5.8 trad lead to the right of Repo Man.  Not as interesting as it's neighbor, but worth romping up if you're waiting for something else in the area.

Once you're on top of the ledge, the guidebook suggests going right of the bolted face and around to the bolts atop the face.  This creates massive amounts of rope drag and it's very dirty... Do the face; it's more fun anyway.

Scramble around for a top rope setup.
content.protection: Up to 2.5"; two bolts on the face, otherwise a BD #3 works fine in the wide crack to the right.
